fixes.name: Profit Margin %
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau [Profit Ratio ] * 100 to a DAX calculated column using row-level multiplication: 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ] * 100.

fixes.name: Revenue Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Net Revenue ] > 1000,
    "High Margin",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 10,
        "Medium Margin",
        "Low Margin"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the nested IF/ELSEIF logic to DAX nested IFs. Uses the previously created calculated column 'Profit Margin %' for the second condition and keeps string literals as in the Tableau formula.

fixes.name: Profit Health
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ] > 0.2,
    IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Tier] = "High", "Excellent", "Good"),
    IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Tier] = "Low", "Poor", "Average")
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the nested Tableau IFs to nested DAX IF statements. References row-level fields 'Profit Ratio ' and 'Revenue Tier' on the same table, so implemented as a calculated column.
